oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Molecular Biology for the Industrial Veterinarian
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: McCracken, Joseph S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: molecular biology
DNA
DNA replication
DNA Transcription
DNA Translation
DNA expression
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: DNA is the primary information carrying molecule for all free living cells. A cell's DNA defines which macromolecules that cell can produce and replication of DNA allows this information to be passed from one generation to the next. Newer techniques in molecular biology allow transfer of specific DNA from one organism to a different organism. The recipient of the new DNA can then produce macromolecules coded for by the exogenous DNA as well as macromolecules coded for by the recipients endogenous DNA.
